data.title: 1909 7vol The works of John Galsworthy
data.meta_description:
1909 7vol The works of John Galsworthy Seven volumes. 

Written by John Galsworthy, an English novelist and playwright who won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1932.
data.text:
Description

Original Binding, Publishers' Original Binding

Seven volumes. Written by John Galsworthy, an English novelist and playwright who won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1932. These volumes include: Villa Rubein. First edition 1908. A Commentary. First edition 1908. Dated from the British Library. The Island Pharisees. Revised edition 1908. Fraternity. Third impression October 1909, originally published March 1909. The Country House. Eighth impression 1910, originally published 1907. Plays: The Silver Box, Joy, and Strife. Third impression 1910, originally published 1909. The Man of Property. Third impression 1910, originally published 1906.

Condition

In the original brown cloth binding. Externally, very smart with light shelf wear and bumping to the extremities, particularly the head and tail of the spines. Tide marks to the rear board of The Man of Property. Contemporary ink inscription to front endpaper. Internally, firmly bound. Pages are very bright and clean with the odd spot.

Overall: Very Good

Delivery & payment

We send all of our books via courier which is a fully tracked and insured service. In our experience we find this to be the most reliable and quickest form of delivery. Our primary courier is DHL, but we are able to accommodate special requests if required, including postal delivery for items under 2kg. See More Details
